comment: personally, I'd want a bedroom, an office, and a guest bedroom.
Most houses seem to not come with an office
"Bedrooms" are also often a room to use as an office or guest room
My place is a 2 bedroom.  If it wasn't for the basement, it'd be itty bitty
we don't have basements here cuz swamp
but this new house is.. I think 3 bedroom
I'm using the front room as a bedroom at the moment, but sometime soonish we'll convert it to an actual bedroom
so it'll increase the value of the house.
Eventually I want to add a bedroom to the basement here
Same reason, plus nice to have if say, I'm renting out the 2nd bedroom and have guests
We have basements because we have to dig down at least 6 feet to get below the frost line anyways
Why fill that in when you can just use that space
you guys up there are lucky
down here it's all swamp, so if you dig less than 10 inches or a few feet into the ground, you get water.
depending on where you are, of course
We can get water here, too.  My own house is evidence of that...
Was less of a problem when the basement drainage drained into city storm sewers
we legit can't even create basements because the water table is right there.
Like, you would have a pool under your house?
it would also kind of damage the support of the house
and ground water here has the habit of keeping snakes and such
also mosquitos are a major problem
yah mold too, but that's just on top of everything else heh
The snakes are just bitey pool noodles
those are the most dangerous type of pool noodle
the ones that can kill you.
Upon further examination, perhaps the under-house pool is not so great

this is a silly place to ask but i couldn't think of a better spot. has anyone else had trouble with Keenspot? I order volume 4 with the signed print and it hasnt been delivered yet. when i try to contact them i don't get a reply.
just wondering if anyone else had had to deal with this and how you delt with it
a lot of people have issues with keenspot not shipping. they seem to have had this issue for a very long time
sad to see it's still a problem now.
you can't really do much about it. Keenspot is probably swamped as always. Make sure to check and see if it's even shipped yet.
the shipping doesn't seem to take long, but they seem to take quite a while to actually send stuff out.
It has been shipped. the problem is its stuck in the border and neither australia post nor usps claim to have it atm. its really annoying me
Sounds like that's not something Keenspot can do anything about for the time being.
i cant do anything either. australia post sayd they dont have it and usps says they dont have it anymore.
theres no border contact for postal items either
USPS wouldn't have it much if they ever had it at all. it would airmail from keenspot's shop directly to a austrailia. USPS is only a united states thing.
it might be in US customs
yeah. in usd too. which is more expencive aswell
did USPS say it went into CBP?
I do not know how it works in Australia, but in Russia a postal item can be of indefinite status for a long time. When the posting left the United States, but did not arrive in Russia. Just wait.
if it's not in US customs, it may be in Austrailia customs, whatever that is called.
but yeah. ive been waiting, 4 months so far
yeah you need to probably contact whatever the customs department of australia is
Here in the US, Customs get packages that are imported, they screen it to make sure it's nothing bad, then give it off to whatever's going to deliver it.
thats how it should work here too
so if your post office or whatnot hasn't gotten it, it's still in your import office.. somewhere. Someone has it.
yeah. with no way of contacting them about it
Here they don't actually track packages in their facilities.. which is dumb and irresponsible. :/
I guess it's the same for you
theres no department for it and they claim no responcibility and shrug it off to australia post (which they havent got it yet)
Pretty shitty since they are literally directly responsible for it..
I mean, I guess all you can do is wait.. and keep calling. Eventually you'll hopefully get in contact with keenspot about it and tell them what's going on.

"Australia Post is the carrier of international mail and has sole responsibility for delivery of your postal article. For enquiries regarding the delivery of your parcel, contact Australia Post on 13 13 18."
and yeah. im gonna have to just wait.. again.
well, if they legally have responsibility of your package, all you can do is just keep calling up the post and ask them where it is.
remembering to remind them that your package is their responsibility to know where it is.
hahah ive done that. theyve been so kind to lodge (another) lost or missing mail form and still nothing.
that was a few months ago.
Unfortunate. You guys have an equally trash mail system as we do.
if anything, you can always come back and talk to tom about it. I don't know if he'll be able to do anything about it though.
he's talked to keenspot about orders like that before though
when they weren't responding to user emails
I've seen it a couple times now
so I mean.. it's worth a try
mhmm/ yeah but like as you said. not really in thier hands atm
well, he's also shipped books himself personally to people that had theirs lost in the mail.
fuck it. yeah, worth a try.
He'll probably be hanging out here in the chat around 8 to 10 hrs from now
gotta go do some things, but I really hope you get everything sorted. :thumbsup:
